meanings.definition: In a messy or unkempt manner.
meanings.sent1: She ran frowzily through the field, her hair flying in all directions.
meanings.sent2: After playing outside all day, the children returned home frowzily, covered in dirt.
meanings.sent3: The puppy shook itself frowzily after rolling in the mud, splattering everyone nearby.
meanings.sent4: The wind whipped frowzily through the trees, scattering leaves in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted frowzily, splashing colors across the canvas with abandon.

meanings.sent1: The frowzily dressed man stumbled out of the bar, his tie askew.
meanings.sent2: The old scarecrow in the field looked frowzily with its tattered clothes and straw sticking out.
meanings.sent3: The frowzily room was a chaotic mess of scattered papers and overturned furniture.
meanings.sent4: Her hair stuck out frowzily in all directions after a windy walk on the beach.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house appeared frowzily, with broken windows and overgrown weeds.
